bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Ralph Cooper Hutchison, October 21, 1937

div1.p: Hench notifies Hutchison of a radio broadcast involving Kissinger.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Ralph Cooper Hutchison, October 21, 1937
div1.opener:
October 21, 1937
Dr. Ralph Hutchison
Washington and Jefferson College
Washington, Pennsylvania
Dear Hutch:
div1.p:
Just a line to let you know that
Mr. Kissinger is going to Hollywood, California
to broadcast from there on the Lux program,
October 25, from 9 to 10 P.M. I don't know
whether that is Central or Eastern time. Kissinger
is the yellow fever fellow. I thought you might
like to know.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
